SEARCH
Package com.icx.jdbc

Class SqlDb

java.lang.Object
com.icx.common.Common
com.icx.jdbc.SqlDb
public class SqlDb extends Common
SQL database connection object based on ConnectionPool provides high level methods to perform SQL SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE statements.

SqlDb object can be created using SqlDb(Properties) from Properties object containing dbConnectionString, dbUser, dbPassword properties.

Using these high level methods programmer avoids to have to deal with details of JDBC programming like handling ResultSet and ResultSetMetaData. Outputs (of SELECT methods) and inputs (of INSERT and UPDATE methods) are sorted maps or list of sorted maps, where such a map is the representation of one table or view record. A record map contains [ column name (label) : value ] pairs and is sorted by column name (or label).

With DEBUG log level all SQL statements performed will be logged as they are - for INSERT and UPDATE statements including real column values and data types. In DEBUG logs also records retrieved by SELECT will be logged including data types. Note: Values of fields or columns which are marked as 'secret' (*) will never be logged. (*) Marked as secret generally means: name contains ignore case 'passwor' or 'pwd' or 'sec_'. Fields annotated with Annotations.Secret annotation are also secret.

Database tables can be 'registered' using registerTable(Connection, String). Resulting SqlDbTable objects provide meta data of these tables and their columns. SqlDbTable provides also methods to analyze table reference structure of database. SqlDbTable objects for registered tables can be retrieved by table name using findRegisteredTable(String). Database tables involved in INSERT and UPDATE methods will be registered internally on first call for performance reasons.

Currently database types MS-SQL, Oracle and MySQL (and MariaDB) are supported. Use getDbType() to check database type programmatically.

  • Field Details

    • DB_QUERYTIMEOUT_PROP

      public static final String DB_QUERYTIMEOUT_PROP
      Property name for database query timeout property (seconds)
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • SqlDb

      public SqlDb(String dbConnectionString, String dbUser, String dbPassword, int connectionPoolSize, int queryTimeout) throws SQLException, ConfigException
      Create SQL database object from parameters.

      JDBC driver class must be accessible in Java class path.

      Parameters:
      dbConnectionString - database connection string (e.g.: "jdbc:sqlserver://localhost;instanceName=MyInstance;databaseName=MyDb", "jdbc:oracle:thin:@//localhost:1521/xe")
      dbUser - database user or null
      dbPassword - password or null
      connectionPoolSize - maximum # of open connections kept in connection pool
      queryTimeout - query timeout in seconds
      Throws:
      ConfigException - if database connection string is null or empty and on unsupported database type (currently supported MS-SQL, Oracle, MySql)
      SQLException - on error opening database connection

    • SqlDb

      public SqlDb(Properties databaseProperties) throws SQLException, ConfigException
      Create database object from Properties object.

      Behaves like SqlDb(String, String, String, int, int).

      Parameters:
      databaseProperties - Properties object which must contain the following properties: dbConnectionString, dbUser, dbPassword and can optionally contain poolSize (defaults to UNLIMITED) and queryTimeout (defaults to 60(s)).
      Throws:
      ConfigException - if database connection string is null or empty and on unsupported database type (currently supported MS-SQL, Oracle, MySql)
      SQLException - on error opening database connection

  • Method Details

    • getPool

      public ConnectionPool getPool()
      Get connection pool associated to this high level SQL database connection.
      Returns:
      database connection pool associated with SqlDb object

    • close

      public void close() throws SQLException
      Close database connection pool and all open database connections.
      Throws:
      SQLException - exception on Connection.close()

    • getDbType

      public SqlDb.DbType getDbType()
      Get database type of this connection (Oracle, MS/SQL).
      Returns:
      database type

    • getSqlDateFunct

      public String getSqlDateFunct()
      Get database type specific SQL date function.
      Returns:
      database specific SQL date function

    • select

      public List<SortedMap<String,Object>> select(Connection cn, String sql, List<Object> valuesOfPlaceholders) throws SQLException
      Perform SQL SELECT operation on given connection.
      Parameters:
      cn - database connection
      sql - SQL SELECT statement, may contain '?' for place holders
      valuesOfPlaceholders - Values which replace place holders
      Returns:
      result records as list of sorted column/value maps
      Throws:
      SQLException - on JDBC or SQL errors

    • selectFrom

      public List<SortedMap<String,Object>> selectFrom(Connection cn, String tableExpr, Object colExpr, String whereClause, String orderByClause, int limit, List<Object> values) throws SQLException, SqlDbException
      Perform SQL SELECT statement on given connection.
      Parameters:
      cn - database connection
      tableExpr - table name or SQL joined table expression like "LEAVES L JOIN COLOURS C ON L.COLOUR_ID = C.ID"
      colExpr - either (1) a list of column names or (2) a SQL column expression string like "NAME, GENDER, BIRTHDATE" or "COUNT(*)" or (3) null, empty list or "*" for "SELECT * FROM..."
      whereClause - SQL where clause string (without "WHERE") or null
      orderByClause - SQL order by clause string (without "ORDER BY") or null
      limit - maximum # of records to retrieve
      values - values to assign to placeholders for prepared statement
      Returns:
      result records as list of sorted column/value maps
      Throws:
      SqlDbException - if table expression is empty or null or column expression type is not of type String or List
      SQLException - on JDBC or SQL errors

    • selectCountFrom

      public long selectCountFrom(Connection cn, String tableName, String whereClause) throws SQLException, SqlDbException
      SELECT record count from given table for given WHERE clause.
      Parameters:
      cn - database connection
      tableName - table name
      whereClause - WHERE clause (without "WHERE")
      Returns:
      record count
      Throws:
      SQLException - on JDBC or SQL errors
      SqlDbException - (cannot be not be thrown here)

    • insertInto

      public int insertInto(Connection cn, String tableName, SortedMap<String,Object> columnValueMap) throws SQLException, SqlDbException
      INSERT one record into a database table on given database connection.
      Parameters:
      cn - database connection
      tableName - database table name
      columnValueMap - Map of: IN: values to set for columns, OUT: real JDBC values set for column after Java -> SQL conversion
      Returns:
      ID of inserted record
      Throws:
      SqlDbException - if table name is null or empty or if column/value map is null or on problems registering database table
      SQLException - on JDBC or SQL errors

    • insertInto

      public int[] insertInto(Connection cn, String tableName, List<SortedMap<String,Object>> columnNameValueMaps) throws SQLException, SqlDbException
      INSERT multiple records per batch insert into a database table on given database connection.
      Parameters:
      cn - database connection
      tableName - database table name
      columnNameValueMaps - list maps containing column name/value entries to insert
      Returns:
      batch execution results
      Throws:
      SqlDbException - if table name is null or empty or if column/value map is null or on problems registering database table
      SQLException - on JDBC or SQL errors

    • update

      public long update(Connection cn, String tableName, Map<String,Object> columnNameValueMap, String whereClause) throws SQLException, SqlDbException
      UPDATE records of a database table on given database connection.

      Registers table before UPDATE if not already done.

      Parameters:
      cn - database connection
      tableName - database table name
      columnNameValueMap - Map of: IN: values to set for columns, OUT: real JDBC values set for column after Java -> SQL conversion
      whereClause - WHERE clause for UPDATE statement (without "WHERE")
      Returns:
      # of records updated
      Throws:
      SqlDbException - if table name is null or empty or if or column/value map is null or on problems registering database table
      SQLException - on JDBC or SQL errors

    • deleteFrom

      public static long deleteFrom(Connection cn, String tableName, String whereClause) throws SQLException, SqlDbException
      Delete records from a database table on given database connection.
      Parameters:
      cn - database connection
      tableName - database table name
      whereClause - WHERE clause for DELETE statement (without "WHERE")
      Returns:
      # of deleted records
      Throws:
      SqlDbException - if table name is null or empty
      SQLException - on JDBC or SQL errors

    • registerTable

      public SqlDbTable registerTable(Connection cn, String tableName) throws SQLException, SqlDbException
      Retrieve and register column meta data for given database table and all referenced tables.
      Parameters:
      cn - database connection
      tableName - name of database table
      Returns:
      registered table object
      Throws:
      SqlDbException - if table name is null or empty, if table does not exist and on JDBC meta data inconsistencies
      SQLException - on JDBC or SQL errors

    • findRegisteredTable

      public SqlDbTable findRegisteredTable(String tableName)
      Try to find already registered table by name.
      Parameters:
      tableName - name of database table
      Returns:
      registered table object or null if table with given name was not registered
